ygData.subject: Re: Arrrgh! I've had it!
ygData.msgSnippet: Sorry, black con?  I don t think I ve ever seen one of those.  What does that mean?  The only things I ve seen were Green, green risky, blue, blue risky,
ygData.messageBody:
Sorry, black con? I don't think I've ever seen one of those. What
does that mean? The only things I've seen were

Green, green risky, blue, blue risky, white, yellow, red.

I've never seen a black con I don't think.

Skeletons gain levels just like monsters do (though they certainly
don't do the same damage). Meaning they eventually get kick, bash, hit
magically, probably double attack and dual wield as well. Whenever I get a
lvl 12 skeleton with Convoke Shadow He can bash and hit magically, level 11
he can't hit magically but can still bash. I've seen a level 16 pet kick so
I know that's what they get at level 16.

Where would I gain XP? At level 9? Grab a fellow Necromancer and
camp Skeleton Lrodd at Befallen. He's often overlooked by the higher levels
because he's in a lame place. He's tough single, but you could do it if you
were lucky. I would just hammer him then run around and kill all the first
level skels for loot and bone chips, then meditate and kill him again. I
would also steer clear of trains, but sometimes try to drag off a mummy or
zombie. This is done by watching the train go past (but stay away), select
a monster, hit it with Ward, then run into an unused room away from the
returning train. Almost always just the monster you pissed off will come
after you unless you cast too close to the group.

Befallen was basically the thing that moved me from 8 to 12 with
hard work. With your crappy 4th level spells pretty much anything else just
laughs at you, though I still use Poison Bolt as a small damage spell.

Malark

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Tony B [mailto:tonyb72@...]
> Sent: Friday, May 07, 1999 8:17 AM
> To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Arrrgh! I've had it!
>
>
> From: "Tony B" <tonyb72@...>
>
> ive been going to najena (sp?) and picking off large and
> greater skeletons
> (beware the trains and rushes). if you can get a good party
> lavastorm is a
> good place to kill fire drakes and dervishes, and even fire
> elementals if
> you have some spell casters and\or tanks with magic weapons.
>
> another good place is n ro, and using your detect undead
> spell. since
> lesser mummies and zombies are good to kill now that you have
> ward undead, i
> have been focusing more on finding quality undead (i can
> sometimes take
> yellow-red undead if i have a good pet).
>
> on a side note, does anyone think pets gain from exp?
> personally, ive kept
> a blue pet and had a good run of kills (a few young kodiaks,
> a halfling,
> bunch of skels) and i noticed that he was hitting faster, and
> stunning
> creatures. i conned him, and low and behold he conned black!
> maybe i was
> on crack, but im going to try it again to verify it for myself.
>
> belphenor
> lodge of the dead
> neriak, fennin ro
>
> >From: "johnathan spectre" <jspectre@...>
> >Hello,
> >I'm a DE Necro who is frustrated with the 9th level. I've
> died and lost it
> >4
> >times now and can't seem to get above one bubble of exp
> before I lose it.
> >Hunting
> >in the forest seems to be worthless, only an occasional
> skeleton gives me
> >any
> >exp (or a kodiak if I can find one), the haflings eat me for
> lunch. I've
> >been
> >to
> >east commons a few times but I die as much as I make
> experience. Befallen
> >seems to be too hard (and I die) or too easy (and no exp). Am I doing
> >something wrong? Should I be hunting elsewhere? I've about
> had it with my
> >necro character, I've recently started a human mage in
> Freeport (eech) and
> >he's having a much easier time. I don't mind slow going but
> I like to see
> >some
> >character advancement.
> >
> >Any suggestions? Any help? I'm about to give up..
> >
